metadata.Title: CVE-2023-39197 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
[netfilter: conntrack: dccp: copy entire header to stack buffer, not just basic one]

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-39197` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1109-azure - 5.4.0-1119.126~18.04.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-5.4.0-150-generic - 5.4.0-166.183~18.04.2
linux-image-5.4.0-150-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-166.183~18.04.2
linux-image-5.4.0-150-lowlatency - 5.4.0-166.183~18.04.2

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: rodrigo-zaiden> probably also known as ZDI-CAN-21202 commit message has a note that dccp contract support might get removed at some point in a near future (not removed as of 2023-11-10)
